ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] bdb:bdb-cache-percent setting disabled - why?
ygData.msgSnippet: In 2.0.x, the BDB environment is already open during job configuration, to store SURT-to-override-sheet associations. Thus, its cache-size is determined

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] bdb:bdb-cache-percent setting disabled - why?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=G91z36MV6BNFqFHhS9v00xBOsxWOsloKaZFoknf9vdKK
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

In 2.0.x, the BDB environment is already open during job configuration, 
to store SURT-to-override-sheet associations. Thus, its cache-size is 
determined outside the other settings, in config.txt. Juergen's 
suggestion is the best workaround for now.

In 2.2.x, the BDB environment(s) will again only be opened at crawl 
launch, so the cache-percent will return to being a normal setting.

Also related: starting in 1.14.3 and 2.0.3, crawl BDB environments will 
by default use the new BDB-JE 'shared-cache' feature -- allowing all 
open environments to use the same heap cache space. This should make 
simultaneous crawls easier to configure and more efficient.

- Gordon @ IA

Juergen Umbrich wrote:
> Hi Holger
>> I hope I do not miss something obvious, but I believe to remember being
>> able to modify "bdb-cache-percent", which is particularly usefull to
>> avoid OOM when using the BloomUriUniqFilter on machines with only
>> moderate RAM, or when running multiple jobs in parallel. In 2.0.0 I get
>> "You cannot edit this setting because it was specifically set for the
>> settings framework. Changing it could destabilize the framework. This
>> setting is only provided in case you want to reuse it in another
>> module." when trying modify this property.
>>
>> Any pointer appreciated.
>>
>>   
> in the profile folder is a file called config.txt:
> #  The percentage of JVM RAM to use for the BDB database during a live 
> crawl. 
> #  Defaults to 60%.
> bdb-bdb-cache-percent=60
> 
> change the value to 20 -30 and everything should be fine.
> 
> hope this helps
> 
> juergen
> 
>> best
>>   Holger
>>
>>   
>
